notes: Level: 2 -- Range: 150’ -- Duration: Instantaneous -- Casting time: 1 action -- Save: Will vs. spell check
general: This necromantic spell requires at least 1 point of spellburn. The caster issues a dangerous strength-draining ray, which destroys the physical prowess of a target. Reducing a creature to 0 Strength transforms it into a jelly-like mass, unable to support its own weight or defend itself from attacks. If a target does not have a defined Strength score, assume 10 for normal humans and man-sized creatures. Lost ability scores heal back at the normal rate.

table.1: caster’s muscles wither, causing him to permanently lose 1 point of Strength
table.2: whenever the caster takes Strength damage in the future, he heals at an abnormally slow rate, requiring two days of healing to recover one lost Strength point
table.3: the caster is no longer able to expend Strength points in spellburn

table.1: one randomly determined ally within range is stricken with a ray that causes him to temporarily lose 1d6 Strength points (no save)
table.2: all allies within range temporarily suffer a wave of weakness, causing them to drop weapons and shields, release their holds on ropes, and so on
table.3: the nearest 1d4 enemies receive a ray of power, which grants them a +2 Strength bonus to attacks and damage for the next turn
table.4: the caster shoots himself in the foot (literally) with a ray of enfeeblement, reducing the strength of his legs and cutting his movement rate in half for the next turn

table.2-11: Failure, but spell is not lost.
table.12-13: With full concentration for one round, the caster can attack one target within range, which must make a Will save or temporarily lose 1d6 points of Strength.
table.14-15: With full concentration for one round, the caster can attack one target within range, which must make a Will save or temporarily lose 1d8+1 points of Strength.
table.16-19: With full concentration for one round, the caster can attack one target within range that temporarily loses 3d6+1 points of Strength. Creatures of 1 HD or less receive no save; others receive a Will save. Additionally, the caster gains 2 points of Strength for 1 turn (does not stack with multiple castings of this spell).
table.20-21: The caster can launch two rays. Each ray does 3d6+1 Strength damage. Creatures of 2 HD or less receive no save; others receive a Will save. Additionally, the caster gains 3 points of Strength for 1 turn.
table.22-25: The caster can launch three rays. Each ray does 4d6+1 Strength damage. Creatures of 2 HD or less receive no save; others receive a Will save. Additionally, the caster gains 4 points of Strength for 1 turn.
table.26-29: The caster can launch four rays. Each ray does 4d6+1 Strength damage. Creatures of 3 HD or less receive no save; others receive a Will save. Additionally, the caster gains 5 points of Strength for 1 turn.
table.30-31: The caster can launch five rays. Each ray does 4d6+1 Strength damage. Creatures of 3 HD or less receive no save; others receive a Will save. Additionally, the caster gains 6 points of Strength for 1 turn.
table.34+: The caster sends forth a burst of debilitating energy that weakens all enemies within a 150’ range! All enemies within range take 4d6+4 Strength damage. Creatures of 3 HD or less receive no save; others receive a Will save. Additionally, the caster gains 6 points of Strength for 1 turn.
